headline: FDIG: The Underwhelming Underachiever
summary: Summary FDIG offers low expenses and diversified crypto equity exposure but lacks the asymmetric upside seen in top-performing peers like BLOK or pure Bitcoin. The ETF's holdings are highly correlated with Bitcoin, benefiting from bull markets but also exposed to sharp drawdowns if sentiment reverses. FDIG's construction prioritizes lower volatility, which limits participation in strong rallies and results in inferior risk-adjusted returns versus competitors. I rate FDIG a hold. For higher growth potential, investors should consider BLOK or direct Bitcoin exposure, as FDIG's strategy is only optimal in a flat market. The Fidelity Crypto Industry and Digital Payments ETF ( FDIG ) is focused on companies in the cryptocurrency and blockchain technology industries. This fund recently caught my attention due to it having one of the lowest expense ratios in my constructed peer universe, but it ultimately failed to live up to my expectations for asymmetric upside. I rate this ETF a hold and will dissect why investors should avoid it in favor of some of its more attractive alternatives. Overview Despite being thematically linked to the crypto industry, FDIG tracks equities only. However, some of its largest holdings, such as Coinbase ( COIN ) and Riot Platforms ( RIOT ), exhibit a strong positive correlation to the movement of Bitcoin. FDIG holds a mix of both pure crypto plays in the form of miners and exchanges, as well as enablers in the form of payment and fintech businesses with strong Bitcoin exposure. These companies comprise the Fidelity Crypto Industry and Digital Payments Index , which is rules-based and passively managed. In order for equities to be selected into the index, companies must have a market cap of over $100 million and have a $2 million daily trading volume. Chinese stocks are not included in the index. Additionally, companies must have more than 50% of their revenues generated from the crypto industry, be it in the form of mining, custody, blockchain infrastructure, or digital payments. Stocks are weighted in the index by their modified average daily trading volume ((ADV)). This means that companies are prioritized for their liquidity rather than market cap. As is common with a thematic ETF, its holdings are fairly concentrated, with its top 10 holdings accounting for 69.32% of its total portfolio. The fund has an expense ratio of 0.40% as well as a dividend yield of 0.97%. Seeking Alpha Outlook FDIG looks attractive at first glance. The fund has a P/E of 24.74. This is contrasted with substantial EPS growth forecasts for its top six holdings, with an average expected jump in EPS of 32.03% and a median increase of 28.84%. Thus, from the perspective of price/earnings-to-growth, its attractively priced relative to its forward growth potential. Company EPS Growth Forecast (2025 vs. 2024) COIN (Coinbase) 49.93% MARA (Marathon) N/A RIOT (Riot Platforms) N/A CLSK (CleanSpark) 20.49% XYZ (Block) 34.48% HOOD (Robinhood) 23.22 Average 32.03% Median 28.84% The common denominator that drives earnings for FDIG's holdings is Bitcoin's price discovery. During bull markets such as today, traders spend more on fees, mining is more profitable, and more users are attracted to the utility of digital payments. FDIG has a positive correlation to Bitcoin's price, so what Bitcoin does next can be reasonably assumed to be a leading indicator for the fund's performance moving forward. Data by YCharts Bitcoin is cyclical and is presently in a strong bull run. Analysts estimate that we're between 640 and 975 days into the upwards cycle. Based on historical patterns before a correction arrives, bull cycles have lasted around 1,000 to 1,200 days. The consensus from analysts suggests that we're currently mid-to-late in Bitcoin's current bull cycle, which suggests that Bitcoin could peak sometime between October this year and mid-2026 at the latest. This suggests that we are not yet at the peak, and that there is real upside still left to be gained while Bitcoin remains structurally strong. There may be a lack of a strong, obvious catalyst on the horizon for Bitcoin (such as an upcoming halving event, next due in 2028), but there are still some clear and powerful structural elements that I believe will sustain its upward trajectory. Trump and Vance's White House administration are explicitly backing Bitcoin through proposed reserve allocations as well as through the GENIUS Act and market structure bills. Then there's also the continued dedollarisation in countries like China, Russia, and Iran, which helped to ignite gold's historic rally over the past year, driven by central bank purchases. As tensions rise between the U.S. and its rivals, I foresee that U.S. treasuries will continue to be sold in favor of alternative assets, which opens the door for Bitcoin to be more heavily considered. These are the two main reasons, in my view, that Bitcoin will maintain structural support. Comparative Analysis FDIG is not the strongest performer when examined in a universe with its peers. However, it has the lowest expense ratio at 0.40%, a mid-range one-year return, and a lower volatility than its peers, which have more mining exposure. ETF Expense Ratio (%) 1Y Return (%) 1M Return (%) 3M Return (%) 6M Return (%) YTD Return (%) FDIG 0.4 31.09 15.98 47.01 7.4 21.08 BITQ 0.85 53.61 14.65 51.31 7.42 26.05 WGMI 0.75 23.13 36.34 82.42 1.3 19.69 BKCH 0.5 20.03 26.95 60.09 -0.05 20.31 DAPP 0.51 50.49 17.99 71.99 8.48 27.35 BLOK 0.73 68 12.48 51.26 23.43 40.89 Over the past five years, FDIG returned 64.95%, while BLOK returned 167.83%. Additionally, BLOK's drawdowns were not substantially worse over the past five years, and it managed to seriously outperform FDIG on rallies, leading to its outperformance. FDIG then is an ETF to compare against, but in my peer universe of thematically similar ETFs, BLOK is the clear winner unless one wants to go with pure Bitcoin exposure and not touch equities at all. Bitcoin has gained 906.97% over the past five years. FDIG's performance is therefore underwhelming. Its construction using modified average daily trading volume ((ADV)) aims to reduce volatility, but in doing so, it also limits the fund's performance to participate in strong rallies. Over the past five years, FDIG has returned less on a risk-adjusted basis relative to BLOK (a Sharpe ratio of 1.45 for FDIG vs 2.56 for BLOK), thus making its fund construction self-defeating in this single yet crucial dimension. It's self-defeating because investors can get similar exposure to BLOK with far more historical upside and better risk-adjusted returns. Seeking Alpha Risks Although we may be in the heat of a bull cycle, Bitcoin has historically topped out and corrected hard when bulls lose enthusiasm. It's entirely possible that Bitcoin will peak later this year rather than mid-2026, which could lead to a rapid drawdown. The same correlation to Bitcoin that gives these ETFs their explosive potential can also act as a strong liability during risk-off scenarios. The second main risk is that although FDIG's P/E of 24.74 seems attractive when compared with the projected EPS growth of its top holdings, this growth is largely speculative and driven largely by the assumption that a bull market will continue for the foreseeable future. A drawdown could compress these multiples sharply, and then suddenly the fund seems far less attractive on a forward basis. Takeaway FDIG is a decent performer, but when compared with the price and risk-adjusted returns of BLOK or holding pure Bitcoin (such as through IBIT), it fails to live up to my expectations of asymmetric upside. FDIG is a hold if investors believe that the crypto market will drift sideways due to its expense ratio. But if one thinks there's still upside left, then BLOK or holding pure Bitcoin are better growth-oriented options. The market would need to grow very slowly in order or stay range-bound for FDIG's present strategy to be superior to its peers, and that seems unlikely given how fast crypto companies are expected to grow in the next year alone.

headline: Bitcoin Reserve Strategy: ZOOZ Power‚Äôs Bold $180M Move Unlocks Crypto Potential
summary: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin Reserve Strategy: ZOOZ Power‚Äôs Bold $180M Move Unlocks Crypto Potential The corporate world is increasingly turning its gaze towards digital assets, and ZOOZ Power is making headlines with its audacious plan to establish a significant Bitcoin Reserve Strategy . This isn‚Äôt just another funding round; it‚Äôs a strategic pivot that could redefine how companies manage their treasuries in the digital age. For anyone tracking the convergence of traditional finance and the burgeoning crypto market, this development from a Nasdaq-listed entity is nothing short of fascinating. ZOOZ Power‚Äôs Vision: Unpacking the Bold Bitcoin Reserve Strategy In a move that has captured the attention of both traditional and crypto investors, Nasdaq-listed ZOOZ Power has announced its intention to raise a substantial $180 million. This capital infusion isn‚Äôt for typical operational expansion; instead, it‚Äôs earmarked specifically to fund an ambitious Bitcoin Reserve Strategy . The funding will be secured through a Private Investment in Public Equity (PIPE) transaction, involving the issuance of 180 million ordinary shares and pre-funded warrants, each priced at $1.00. This significant financial maneuver is, however, contingent upon securing shareholder approval, underscoring the company‚Äôs commitment to transparency and governance in this pioneering endeavor. The decision to allocate such a considerable sum towards a Bitcoin Reserve Strategy signals a profound shift in corporate treasury management, moving beyond traditional fiat currencies and conventional investment vehicles. It reflects a growing recognition among forward-thinking companies of Bitcoin‚Äôs potential as a store of value, an inflation hedge, and a strategic asset in an increasingly digitized global economy. Why a Bitcoin Reserve Strategy Now? Understanding the Motivation Why would a company like ZOOZ Power, primarily known for its ultra-fast electric vehicle charging solutions, venture into the volatile world of cryptocurrencies? The answer lies in a confluence of macroeconomic factors and a bold vision for the future of corporate finance. For years, companies have sought stable, high-yield assets for their treasury reserves. However, with persistent inflation concerns, low-interest rates on traditional holdings, and the unpredictable nature of global markets, many are seeking alternative strategies. A Bitcoin Reserve Strategy offers several compelling advantages: Inflation Hedge: Bitcoin‚Äôs fixed supply of 21 million coins makes it a scarce asset, often dubbed ‚Äòdigital gold.‚Äô This scarcity can protect purchasing power against the devaluation of fiat currencies. Diversification: Adding Bitcoin to a corporate treasury can diversify asset holdings, potentially reducing overall portfolio risk by introducing an asset class with a low correlation to traditional markets. Potential for Appreciation: Despite its volatility, Bitcoin has demonstrated significant long-term growth potential, offering companies an opportunity for substantial capital appreciation on their reserves. Innovation and Forward-Thinking: Adopting a Bitcoin Reserve Strategy positions a company as innovative and technologically savvy, appealing to a new generation of investors and talent. This move echoes the pioneering steps taken by companies like MicroStrategy, which famously adopted Bitcoin as its primary treasury reserve asset, demonstrating the viability and potential benefits of such a strategy for publicly traded companies. The Powerhouse Investors: Who‚Äôs Backing This Bold Bitcoin Reserve Strategy? The credibility of ZOOZ Power‚Äôs Bitcoin Reserve Strategy is significantly bolstered by the caliber of strategic investors participating in the PIPE offering. This isn‚Äôt just any group of investors; it‚Äôs a who‚Äôs who of prominent names in the cryptocurrency and venture capital space, signaling strong institutional confidence in the company‚Äôs new direction. Pantera Capital: A leading blockchain-focused investment firm, known for its early and significant investments in the crypto ecosystem. Their involvement speaks volumes about the perceived potential. FalconX: A prime brokerage for institutional crypto trading, their participation highlights the growing institutional demand for digital assets and the professional execution capabilities required for such a strategy. Arrington Capital: Founded by TechCrunch founder Michael Arrington, this firm is a well-respected name in blockchain and crypto investments, further validating the strategic shift. UTXO Management: A firm specifically focused on Bitcoin investments, their participation directly aligns with and reinforces the core of ZOOZ Power‚Äôs Bitcoin Reserve Strategy . ATW Partners and Alex Rabinovitch: These participants bring additional strategic capital and expertise, rounding out a formidable consortium of backers. The collective involvement of these sophisticated investors is a powerful endorsement, indicating that ZOOZ Power‚Äôs move is not merely speculative but a well-considered financial and strategic decision with significant backing from those deeply entrenched in the digital asset space. Jordan Fried: Steering the Digital Asset Ship for the Bitcoin Reserve Strategy Further cementing its commitment to this new direction, ZOOZ Power has announced that Jordan Fried will join as CEO on July 31. Fried‚Äôs appointment is particularly significant as he is set to lead the company‚Äôs digital asset treasury, making him the key architect and executor of the new Bitcoin Reserve Strategy . His background in the blockchain and digital asset space is expected to provide the necessary expertise and vision to navigate the complexities of managing a significant crypto reserve. Fried‚Äôs leadership will be crucial in implementing robust security protocols, managing market volatility, ensuring regulatory compliance, and optimizing the performance of the Bitcoin holdings. His role underscores the specialized knowledge required to successfully integrate digital assets into traditional corporate finance frameworks, moving beyond mere speculation to a structured, long-term strategic asset management approach. Navigating the Crypto Waters: Challenges and Considerations for a Bitcoin Reserve Strategy While the potential benefits of a Bitcoin Reserve Strategy are compelling, it‚Äôs crucial to acknowledge the inherent challenges and risks. Bitcoin‚Äôs price volatility remains a significant concern for corporate treasuries, which typically prioritize stability and liquidity. A sudden downturn in Bitcoin‚Äôs value could impact a company‚Äôs balance sheet and investor confidence. Other challenges include: Regulatory Uncertainty: The regulatory landscape for cryptocurrencies is still evolving globally. Changes in regulations could impact the legality of holding digital assets, their tax treatment, or their liquidity. Custody and Security: Storing significant amounts of Bitcoin securely requires specialized expertise to protect against hacking, theft, or loss of private keys. Accounting and Reporting: Integrating Bitcoin into traditional accounting frameworks presents complexities, particularly concerning impairment testing and fair value accounting. Public Perception: Some traditional investors might view a crypto-heavy treasury as overly risky or speculative, potentially affecting stock performance or access to traditional financing. ZOOZ Power‚Äôs success with its Bitcoin Reserve Strategy will depend heavily on its ability to mitigate these risks through comprehensive risk management frameworks, secure custody solutions, and clear communication with shareholders and regulators. A New Era for Corporate Treasuries? What ZOOZ Power‚Äôs Move Means ZOOZ Power‚Äôs bold step could signal a broader trend in corporate finance. As the digital economy expands and traditional financial systems face new pressures, more companies might explore a Bitcoin Reserve Strategy as a legitimate and strategic component of their treasury management. This isn‚Äôt just about investing in Bitcoin; it‚Äôs about acknowledging the fundamental shift in global finance and positioning a company to thrive in a decentralized future. This development will likely spur discussions across boardrooms worldwide, prompting finance executives to evaluate the merits of digital assets beyond speculative trading. It challenges conventional wisdom and encourages a re-evaluation of what constitutes a ‚Äòsafe‚Äô or ‚Äòoptimal‚Äô corporate treasury in the 21st century. summary: The post RAKBANK Becomes First UAE Bank to Launch Retail Crypto Trading: Details appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News This is a bold move and one to watch! headline: Ethereum's Success Won't Translate Into Altcoins
summary: Summary Ether‚Äôs recent price gains have market pundits predicting an impending Altcoin Season. Altcoin‚Äôs are ‚Äúoscillators at best‚Äù and two ingredients for their success are missing. Cryptocurrency deregulation will benefit Ethereum more than Bitcoin. The Dencun and Pectra upgrades sharply lowered fees going to the L1 and increased ETH‚Äôs inflation. Ethereum is an institutional-gradeblockchain with several unique bullish factors. Thesis: Investor sentiment for Ethereum ( ETH-USD ) shifted dramatically from depressed and apathetic to enthusiastic. The recent drop in Bitcoin Dominance alongside strong positive momentum for Ethereum has translated to predictions of an Altcoin Season. This makes complete sense given that ETH is the Altcoin market‚Äôs 600lb gorilla. And as the saying goes, ‚Äúso goes ETH, so goes the Altcoin market.‚Äù However, this time is different, as we‚Äôre missing two pieces of the puzzle. This article discusses my Rating Scorecard, trends within Ethereum, why ETH could perform well without an Altcoin Season and how we can get to the ‚Äúbanana zone‚Äù in crypto. Introduction Ethereum ( ETH-USD ) is a distributed blockchain platform for smart contracts and decentralized applications. Ethereum‚Äôs smart contracts have enabled the creation of various new assets and industries such as Decentralized Finance ( DEFI ), NFTs and DAOs (for governance)‚Ä¶Ethereum uses a Proof of Stake (PoS) consensus mechanism where validators secure the network and participate in block production. Ratings Framework Ethereum is rated highly under my Ratings Scorecard which includes 12 factors. In summary, the project rates below-average under Vitalik Buterin‚Äôs Blockchain Trilemma (e.g., Decentralization, Scaleability, Security) as well as User Experience. Vitalik has chosen to focus on Security rather than Scaleability and Decentralization. That being said, management and the Ethereum Foundation are working on alleviating its shortcomings. Ethereum‚Äôs roadmap can be found here . Ethereum rates well for Ecosystem Development, Funding, Developers, (new) Management team, Roadmap, Use-Case, Tokenomics and Social Engagement. Ethereum also benefits from Lindy‚Äôs Law as it‚Äôs been around for a decade and has been copied, forked and battle-tested. Ethereum‚Äôs been said to work in an ‚ÄúIvory Tower‚Äù away from the real world as Vitalik philosophizes about blockchain. Developers of Dapps have complained that Ethereum doesn‚Äôt reach out to them or ‚Äúreturn phone calls‚Äù all of which sapped the excitement out of the chain in favor of sexier projects such as Solana ( SOL-USD ). Again, Ethereum‚Äôs steady, slow and corporate while Solana is entrepreneurial. Prophetizing Ethereum ETH‚Äôs having its most dramatic shift in history as skeptics jump onto the bull bandwagon. Despite being a long-term ETH bull, I have been fairly critical of them on social media (see below). I think their largest mistake was not shifting the narrative to ‚ÄúETH as store of value‚Äù as they executed the ‚ÄúDencun‚Äù and ‚ÄúPectra‚Äù upgrades ‚Äì both of which significantly reduced the amount of fee-revenues going to the L1. This effectively lowers intrinsic value using the DCF valuation method, making Ethereum appear overvalued relative to its current market cap. Author's creation, LinkedIn The chart below shows how Ethereum‚Äôs inflation rate initially declined post-Merge‚Äù (move to proof-of-stake) but inevitably rose to 0.8%/year due to its upgrades. Ultrasound Money The Ethereum Foundation‚Äôs change in focus has given investors hope. This is best evangelized by Etherealize ‚Äì their bull case is summarized in the table below. (Note: just to be clear, I don‚Äôt ‚Äúbuy‚Äù all of their bullish factors ‚Äì several of which repeat themselves. On the rightmost column, I marked the ones that are uniquely bullish factors to Ethereum as ‚ÄúYes‚Äù, as the others are common in other layer 1 chains.) Author's creation, Etherealize data The Comeback Kid This term refers to someone who bounces back from hardship to achieve success again. The term often highlights resilience and the ability to persevere through challenging circumstances. Ok, maybe I‚Äôm stretching this a little bit, but in some ways Ethereum is the comeback kid. Yes, it didn‚Äôt go through a near-death experience like Solana, but Ethereum had a turnaround nonetheless. Recent changes in leadership at the Ethereum Foundation and a strategic focus on the layer 1‚Äôs scalability and U/X should result in a new lease on life. If you recall, Ethereum gave up on internal sharding and instead moved to dozens of L2s ‚Äì all of which have different U/X‚Äôs. The Pectra upgrade resolves this issue via Account Abstraction ( EIP-7702) that: Improves U/X and user-experience Simplifies the development of Dapps And enhances security by providing multi-factor and other recovery options Recently Coinbase‚Äôs ( COIN ) Base-chain introduced a rebranded Base App that is a super-App platform (apps, one-tap payments, trading, social-media‚Ä¶) that ‚Äúabstracts-away‚Äù all the friction points that have been hindering non-tech users from joining Web3. Ether as Digital Oil I would like to expand on factors from the above table that are mostly unique to Ethereum. Qualitatively, I believe Ethereum will be successful as cryptocurrency deregulation pivots the market to professional money managers and institutions such as banks. There are three bills which favor Ethereum: the Genius Bill (signed by Trump) for stablecoins, the Anti-CBDC Act and the CLARITY ACT. I expect the latter two will be signed into law by year-end. Institutions favor Ethereum for many reasons, some of which mirror themselves, meaning they‚Äôre comfortable working with technologies that are well-established and battle-tested. Asset managers also like the fact that Ethereum pays ‚Äúdividends‚Äù in the form of staking returns (~ 3% yield ). Since Ether is a store of value and battle-tested, institutions prefer tokenizing assets on its platform without worrying if it‚Äôll be around years from now or whether it‚Äôll have high inflation. One concrete example showing that institutions are indeed interested in Ethereum is the volume of ETH CFDs. These are institutional derivative contracts for the difference between the opening and closing price of ETH. ETH‚Äôs market share of volume surged from 6.6% in FY‚Äô24 to 13.6% as of 1H‚Äô25. Wintermute About 55% of all tokenized assets (includes Stablecoins) are on Ethereum and this will rise quickly now that Genius has been signed into law. Further, if you include the Ethereum ecosystem (L2s, rollups) that percentage rises to over 75% (league table below). RWA.xyz ETH as a Strategic Reserve Asset Now that I‚Äôve presented all the attributes that make Ethereum (the blockchain network) and ETH the native currency so revered to institutions, it makes sense that they would want to stockpile it into a treasury reserve as has been done with Bitcoin. Sharplink‚Äôs ( SBET ) Joe Lubin is to ETH in what MicroStrategy‚Äôs ( MSTR ) Michael Saylor is to BTC. You can think of ETH treasuries as Bitcoin with extra bells & whistles as the treasuries will be gathering Defi returns. The table below shows the largest treasuries and The Ether Machine recently joined with a stated goal of having $1.5Bn in ETH. Strategic.ETH.Reserve.xyz Some asset managers (especially smaller managers) have chosen to participate in ETH ‚Äúownership‚Äù by purchasing spot ETFs that custody Ether. The recent trend in ETF flows towards Ethereum rather than Bitcoin is the largest I‚Äôve seen since ETH ETFs were first approved last year. In the table below, notice the percentage of Ethereum flows has sharply increased this year. For example, they rose from 38% of Bitcoin‚Äôs flow YTD to 89% MTD. CoinShares Is ETH‚Äôs 60% bull run a harbinger of Altcoin Season ? I believe the recent runup in ETH‚Äôs price is Ethereum normalizing back to its place as digital Silver as Bitcoin is to Gold. In my previous articles over the last year, I stated that we probably won‚Äôt have Altcoin Season until at least May‚Äô25 and by ‚ÄúBy George‚Äù that‚Äôs exactly when ETH started mooning. However, the reasons why I said ‚Äúwait till May‚Äù was that I assumed that a) the U.S. and or global economies would slow and b) that the Fed would begin Quantitative Easing and this will show itself by accelerating M2 growth (chart below). Neither has happened, albeit M2 growth has risen from 6% during my last article to 8% (tipping point ?). The U.S. Unemployment Rate remains at a low 4.1% (June 2025) despite ‚Äúsoft data‚Äù remaining lackluster. Consequently, I think Altcoins are Oscillators at best, but more likely they‚Äôre Call Options that steadily decline towards zero. Remember, low entry-barriers have allowed for the number of created cryptocurrencies to rise from 20,000 (previous Altcoin Season) to a whopping 18.88 million. That‚Äôs a lot of supply ! CoinMarketCap BGeometrics Speculation is getting Rampant My proprietary Indicators of Risk within financial markets show we‚Äôre near a local top and near peak speculation (though not as high as 2021). I am seeing confluence with other markets including crypto. As you can see in the charts below, crypto is also near peak speculation. The charts show just how excessive this speculation is. The first chart shows that Perpetual Futures Premiums on Altcoins are quite high (meaning there‚Äôs high demand for leveraged long exposure ) and tend to peak near local tops. The second chart shows that Whales holding Bitcoin are transferring coins to exchanges, which is typically done when they‚Äôre preparing to sell them. (Remember: Altcoins are tied to the hip of Bitcoin.) GlassNode GlassNode So then why am so Bullish on ETH ? I think ETH and especially Altcoins, could have a correction during the near-term as we wait for the Fed to add liquidity. However, I remain bullish (Rated ‚Äú Strong Buy ‚Äù) for my 10 year time horizon. There‚Äôs considerable resistance at the $4000-plus level on the chart, and according to Glassnode, it‚Äôll be excessively difficult getting past $4,500, as this level represents one standard deviation of Ethereum‚Äôs active realized price. I leave you with a quote from Kevin Li (@ Artemis): ‚ÄúETH isn‚Äôt just like a Cloud software company or a simple Utility token for transaction fees. Rather, it represents a scarce, programmable, and economically essential reserve asset‚Äîone that underpins the security, settlement, and functionality of a progressively institutionalized on-chain financial ecosystem.‚Äù GlassNode
